schedule.name: Description
schedule.description: In three days, you can reboot and jumpstart your way to a healthier body. While many detox programs require you to fast and allow only tonics for days, this 3-day detox plan does not go extreme. You are not bound to just greens and all day of juices. You will be eating whole foods that nourish your body while they flash toxins out and clean your body inside and out. It's a 3 meal a day plan that starts with immune boosting, hydrating juice and end the day with a heart warming soup that's rich in nutrients and green power. Repeat the following menu for 3 days.

data.name: Juice Detox
data.description: Are you ready to feel better, have more energy, sleep more deeply, breathe more freely, think more clearly, and feel more vibrant? Giving the body a rest from solid food and nurturing it briefly with easily digested, nutrient-dense juices can improve health.
data.shortDescription: Are you ready to feel better, have more energy, sleep more deeply, breathe more freely, think more clearly, and feel more vibrant? Giving the body a rest from solid food and nurturing it briefly with easily digested, nutrient-dense juices can improve health by healing the body and renewing the body, mind, and spirit.

schedule.name: Description
schedule.description: Are you ready to feel better, have more energy, sleep more deeply, breathe more freely, think more clearly, and feel more vibrant? Giving the body a rest from solid food and nurturing it briefly with easily digested, nutrient-dense juices can improve health by healing the body and renewing the body, mind, and spirit.

schedule.name: Instructions
schedule.description:
1. Make one recipe each day, beginning with the Green Juice. Each recipe makes about 64 ounces. Store your juice in a sealed pitcher.

2. Refrigerate and consume 1 cup of juice very hour, for a total of 8 hours. Every meal for these 3 days will consist of juice only, except for dinner.

3. Every 30 minutes, drink one cup of water or more, avoiding alcohol or caffeine.

4. Your last meal of the day will be a full meal and should consist only of grilled or baked 'great protein' or vegetables. Avoid starches and processed food.

5. Finish each evening with a glass of warm chamomile tea with freshly squeezed lemon.

data.name: 1-Day Easy Diet
data.description: Below is a sample menu for a full day to give you an idea of what types of foods you should be eating, what portions should look like and how to prepare for them. The outline looks like this: breakfast, snack, lunch, snack, dinner. Timing? That’s up to you!
data.shortDescription: Below is a sample menu for a full day to give you an idea of what types of foods you should be eating, what portions should look like and how to prepare for them. The outline looks like this: breakfast, snack, lunch, snack, dinner. Timing? That’s up to you!

schedule.name: Description
schedule.description: Weight loss is achieved when you find something that works for you. Regardless of your body type, genetics or lifestyle, you can lose weight, but you still have to eat. Your body needs fuel! Below is a sample menu for a full day to give you an idea of what types of foods you should be eating, what portions should look like and how to prepare for them. Your daily caloric intake needs might differ from one person to the next, but this is a great place to start. The outline looks like this: breakfast, snack, lunch, snack, dinner. Timing? That’s up to you! You’ll want to eat your breakfast within the first 30 to 60 minutes of waking up and don’t skip dinner!

data.name: GM Diet
data.description: The GM diet has been around since 1985. It was originally developed by General Motors for its employees. It was designed to increase workforce productivity by making the workers healthier. Results of the diet were impressive – a loss of 10 to 17 pounds of weight in just a week!
data.shortDescription: The GM diet has been around since 1985. It was originally developed by General Motors for its employees. schedule.name: Description
schedule.description: The GM diet has been around since 1985. It was originally developed by General Motors, along with the Food and Drug Administration and the United States Department of Agriculture, for its employees. It was designed to increase workforce productivity by making the workers healthier. Results of the diet were impressive – a loss of 10 to 17 pounds of weight in just a week!

data.description: This diet is really a trend diet plan that’s been around since the '80s. Some of the positive aspects it’s proponents claim include a faster weight loss, a rise in vitality in addition to a decrease in cholesterol levels. it is especially attractive to many because it should be only 2-4 days long.

schedule.description: The diet cannot last more than 3 consecutive days, it can always be resumed a 4-day break between  diet periods. Only artificial sweeteners are permitted. Snacks are not.
